div.p: We aimed to solve the crystal structure of various regions of the human Topoisomerase IIβ Binding Protein (TopBP1) in order to better understand its role in the DNA damage response. TopBP1 has eight BRCT domains that are implicated in binding to phosphorylated proteins involved in DNA damage response (Yamane et al., 1997). BRCT domains 1 and 2 are involved in binding to the 9-1-1 complex in order to recruit TopBP1 to stalled replication forks (Delacroix, et al., 2007), while the 5th BRCT domain is essential for TopBP1 foci formation (Yamane et al., 2002). The activation domain (AD), located between BRCT domains 6 and 7, is required for ATR/ATRIP activation of the checkpoint response (Kumagai, et al., 2006) (Figure 1).

We have mapped, in vivo, various BRCT domains involved in recruiting TopBP1 to sites of DNA damage, with certain domains implicated in recruitment to either DNA double strand breaks or stalled replication forks. We subsequently expressed various fragments of human TopBP1 containing the activation domain and BRCT domains in E. coli. Using classical ion-exchange and size-exclusion chromatography, we have purified and set up crystal screens for these various TopBP1 fragments. All experiments, from purification through crystal screening, were performed TopBP1 resolution refinement trials MX-1241 ID23-2 from 2nd of March 2011 to 3rd of March 2011 1shift Local contact: Dr. Ricardo FERRAZ LEAL
